intros.antiquity: The buyers of #FallenLondon look to the past! This week's fad quality is Antiquity.
intros.amalgamy: An interest in all things rubbery takes #FallenLondon by storm! This week's fad quality is Amalgamy.
intros.menace: A taste for the macabre invests #FallenLondon! This week's fad quality is Menace.
intros.bird: It seems everyone has been dreaming feathers! This week's zoological mania is for Birds.
intros.amphibian: The Bone Market croaks with activity! This week's zoological mania is for Amphibians.
intros.fish: Zailors swarm the Bone Market! This week's zoological mania is for Fish.
intros.insect: The Bone Market is crawling with buyers! This week's zoological mania is for Insects.
intros.midnighter: A Dreary Midnighter has descended from the surface in search of realistic skeletons!
intros.salesman: The Enterprising Boots Salesman is on the lookout for many-legged skeletons to display!

antiquity:
*Fluctuations: Antiquity week*

- The Enthusiast will give one additional Unprovenanced Artifact
- The Zailor and the Author will give additional secondary rewards equal to half the skeleton's Antiquity
- The Ambassador will give Tailfeathers equal to Antiquity^2.1
amalgamy:
*Fluctuations: Amalgamy week*

- The Servant will give five additional Ambiguous Eoliths
- The Zailor and the Collector will give additional secondary rewards equal to half the skeleton's Amalgamy
- The Entrepreneur will give Memories of Distant Shores equal to Amalgamy^2.1
menace:
*Fluctuations: Menace week*

- Mrs Plenty will give one additional Basket of Rubbery Pies
- The Author and the Collector will give additional secondary rewards equal to half the skeleton's Menace
- The Teller of Terrors will give Royal Blue Feathers equal to Menace^2.1

bird:
*Zoological Mania: Birds*

Declaring a skeleton a Bird will increase its value by 10%!
To do so you must have a Comprehensive Study of Avian Anatomies, Oneiric and Otherwise 
and your skeleton must have ANY # of skulls, EXACTLY 2 wings and 2 legs, NO arms/fins, and AT MOST 1 tail.
reptile:
*Zoological Mania: Reptiles*

Declaring a skeleton a Reptile will increase its value by 10%!
To do so you must have a Complete Account of Frogs, Toads, and Other Croaking Beasts 
and your skeleton must have EXACTLY 1 skull, AT MOST 4 legs, NO arms/fins/wings, and EXACTLY 1 tail.
amphibian:
*Zoological Mania: Amphibians*

Declaring a skeleton an Amphibian will increase its value by 10%!
To do so you must have a Complete Account of Frogs, Toads, and Other Croaking Beasts 
and your skeleton must have EXACTLY 1 skull, EXACTLY 4 legs, NO arms/wings/fins, and NO tail.
fish:
*Zoological Mania: Fish*

Declaring a skeleton an Amphibian will increase its value by 10%!
To do so you must have an Unexpurgated Accounting of the Anatomies of Aquatic Life-forms 
and your skeleton must have EXACTLY 1 skull, AT LEAST 2 fins, NO arms/legs/wings, and AT MOST 1 tail.
insect:
*Zoological Mania: Insects*

Declaring a skeleton an Insect will increase its value by 15%!
To do so you must have a Survey of Arachnids and Insects Native to the Neath and Unterzee 
and your skeleton must have EXACTLY 1 skull, EXACTLY 6 legs, AT MOST 4 wings, and NO arms/fins/tails.
arachnid:
*Zoological Mania: Arachnids*

Declaring a skeleton an Arachnid will increase its value by 15%!
To do so you must have a Survey of Arachnids and Insects Native to the Neath and Unterzee 
and your skeleton must have EXACTLY 8 legs, AT MOST 1 tail, and NO skulls/arms/fins/tails.

enthusiast: He wants skeletons with AT LEAST 2 skulls;
he pays in Pieces of Rostygold equal to your skeleton's value in pennies and in
Vital Intelligence equal to (number of skulls - 1)^1.8; he gives 1 Exhaustion for every 4 Vital Intelligence.
midnighter:
*Occasional Buyer: Dreary Midnighter*

He wants NO chimeras or Curators, NO Amalgamy and NO Support for a Counter-Church Theology; 
he pays in  Fistfuls of Surface Currency equal to your skeleton's value/3 + 100 (3e bonus) and 
one Vienna Opening (2.5e/5 Scrip bonus); he gives no exhaustion.
phantasist: She wants AT LEAST 2 Implausibility and AT LEAST 4 of either Antiquity/Amalgamy/Menace;
she pays in various 0.5e resources equal to your skeleton's value/50 + 2 (1e bonus) and
in 2.5e resources equal to Implausibility*(Antiquity or Amalgamy or Menace, ignores fluctuations);
she gives 1 Exhaustion for every 20 units of secondary payout.
malacologist: he pays in Preserved Surface Blooms equal to your skeleton's value/250 + 1 (2.5e bonus) and
in Volumes of Collated Research equal to (Tentacles^2.2)/5;
he gives 1 Exhaustion for every 20 Volumes of Collated Research.
salesman: He wants skeletons with NO Menace or Amalgamy and AT LEAST 4 legs;
he pays in Whisper-Satin Scraps equal to your skeleton's value in pennies/50 and
in Ostentatious Diamonds equal to the skeleton's number of legs^2.2;
he gives 1 Exhaustion for every 100 Ostentatious Diamonds.
